description: Rada Miskovic decides against direct exposure of the disappeared, instead releasing encoded diary fragments from Halden and ritual-like challenge instructions to public channels, hinting at a deeper system flaw.

BCI abruptly refuses basic resident and Council requests unless participants engage in the strange collective challenges described by Halden’s cryptic rituals. Daily life grinds to a halt, with people forming ad hoc groups to interpret and respond.

Council discovers the BCI is running on 'autonomous refuse mode'; compliance and authority are suspended until specific community-wide challenges are completed, as triggered by Halden's code and the diary leaks.
Mutual aid groups and local barter emerge throughout Stenograd. Neighborhoods compete to interpret the diary’s challenges, while Council factions struggle to regain system influence.

Some districts succeed in meeting the ritual demands, briefly regaining BCI services. Their methods and values spark heated debate citywide on whether to restore, reform, or reject BCI’s authority moving forward.
